title: All Three Asymptote Types
description: Interactive comparison of vertical, horizontal, and oblique asymptotes showing their defining characteristics through side-by-side and overlay visualizations.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Mathematics
Calculus
Precalculus
learningObjective: Students will differentiate between vertical, horizontal, and oblique asymptotes by analyzing their defining characteristics.
prerequisites: Familiarity with limits and infinity notation

controls.label: Zoom
controls.description: Adjust zoom level to see asymptotic behavior at different scales

equations: Vertical example: f(x) = 1/(x-2), asymptote at x = 2
Horizontal example: f(x) = (2x+1)/(x+3), asymptote at y = 2
Oblique example: f(x) = (x^2-1)/(x-2), asymptote at y = x + 2
assumptions: Functions are displayed within a bounded viewing window
Near-asymptote behavior is clipped for visual clarity
limitations: Cannot zoom infinitely close to vertical asymptotes
Fixed example functions rather than user-defined
